xml.p: Introduction: "Oh... Hello! I'm Penny..." #!String
Resort_Entering: "This island is so beautiful!" #!String
Resort_Leaving: "I had a great time.$h" #!String
Resort_Shore: "I'm a little embarrassed wearing my bathing suit in public.$s#$b#I hope no one's looking...$s" #!String
Resort_Shore_2: "Somehow, the water here looks so different...#$e#I can hardly believe this is the same ocean I've been gazing at my entire life." #!String
Resort_Towel: "The wind keeps making me lose my page, but it feels really great on the skin.$h" #!String
Resort_Towel_2: "I'm reading a book about a sailor who washes up on a deserted island.#$b#I wonder what I would do in that sort of a situation?" #!String
Resort_Marriage_Towel_2: "Hey honey, do you mind standing a little to the left?#$b#Thanks, the sun was making it a little bit hard to read!$h" #!String
Resort: "This sand is so soft and fine. It feels great on my toes!$h" #!String
Mon: "Hi... #$e#Oh, did you want something?" #!String
danceRejection: "Oh... No, thanks.$s" #!String
breakUp: "...$s#$b#I... I see... *sniff* ... W... We can just be friends, then.$s" #!String
pamHouseUpgrade: "What you did for my family is so generous. Thank you!" #!String
pamHouseUpgradeAnonymous: "There are some truly wonderful people in the world..." #!String
dumped_Girls: "I can't bear to see you...$s" #!String
divorced: "...Please, leave me alone.$s" #!String
secondChance_Girls: "You've left a permanent scar on my heart, @. Still... I'm ready to speak to you again.$s" #!String

Mon4: "*sigh*... My mother definitely has a problem with going to the saloon too much.$s#$q 7/8 Mon_old#But it's best not to dwell on bad things, right?#$r 7 50 Mon_7#Right. It's best to be positive!#$r 8 10 Mon_8#I think it's good to be realistic." #!String
Mon_old: "#$p 7#But if I keep trying I think I can get her to change.|I guess it makes sense. There's not much I can do to change it, anyway." #!String
Mon_7: "That's how I feel. I'm just going to focus on making the future better." #!String
Mon_8: "Maybe you're right. It's better to cope with reality.$u" #!String
Mon8: "I'm eager to move out. It's such a burden to be worrying about Mom all the time.#$e#I want her to be happy, but I can't stay here forever... you know?$s" #!String
Tue: "I'm tutoring Vincent and Jas today... They're a handful, but it's nice to make a difference in someone's life." #!String

Tue4: "$d bus#Maybe now that my mother has her bus driving job back, I can start saving more money. Things are looking a little brighter.|I'm trying to save money from my tutoring job, but it's hard with my mother out of work.$s" #!String
Tue10: "Um, @? A farm seems like a good place for children, don't you think?$l#$e#It was just a thought I had.$l" #!String

Wed: "We don't have a school here but I'm doing my best to give Vincent and Jas a proper education.#$e#Every child deserves a chance to be successful.#$e#Jas is very good at math and reading. Vincent is good at... well, he has an active imagination!" #!String

Wed2: "You know what? I should take the children on a field trip some time. Maybe to the forest.#$e#A guest speaker would be nice... maybe someone familiar with nature?#$e#Sorry, I'm just thinking out loud." #!String
Wed4: "I've lived in Pelican Town my whole life. Can you believe that?#$e#I guess there's a lot out there I'll never experience." #!String

Thu: "We're very lucky to have a library in such a small town.#$e#When you're lost in a book, it's easy to forget the realities of your life.$u#$e#...Maybe that's why I like reading so much.$s#$e#...Sorry. I got carried away there." #!String
Thu6: "I wish I could keep a garden, but our yard is such a mess.$u#$e#Maybe I'll live in a place where I can have a garden someday.#$e#Maybe I'll live on a farm! *giggle*$h" #!String
Fri: "If you dig in the dirt you can find some interesting things.#$e#One time I found a really old piece of pottery. I brought it to Gunther and he said it was over a thousand years old." #!String
Fri2: "If you dig in the dirt you can find some interesting things.#$e#One time I found a really old piece of pottery. I brought it to Gunther and he said it was over a thousand years old." #!String
Fri4: "Dishes, dishes, dishes. Ugh... If my mother wasn't always nursing a headache from her late nights at the saloon, maybe she could help around the house a little.$s" #!String
Sat: "This is such a small town. You can't avoid meeting everyone.#$e#I wonder what it's like to live in the city?" #!String

Sat2: "$d Joja#Things changed a lot after the JojaMart went up. It's been really bad for Pierre's shop. Mom loves JojaMart, though. The prices are cheap, so she can afford a lot more there than she ever could at Pierre's.|Mom's been complaining ever since JojaMart closed down. I think it's good for her, though. Maybe she'll drink less Joja Cola now." #!String
Sun: "Hello. Ummm...$u#$b#The weather's interesting today, don't you think?#$e#Sorry...$u" #!String
Sun4: "I've been trying to keep our place clean, but it always gets messy again.$s#$e#It's hard to run a household all by yourself.$u" #!String
event_speaker_kids1: "Oh no?$l#$b#Well, I guess that makes sense... you're busy with other things right now." #!String
event_speaker_kids2: "... Me too. I'm glad you feel that way.$7" #!String
event_speaker_kids3: "Yes... the urge to care for something innocent and helpless. It makes sense that we'd feel that." #!String
event_speaker_kids4: "Oh, really?$s#$b# I think you'd make a good parent.$7" #!String
event_speaker_kids5: "hmm...$s#$b#If everyone thought like that, humans would die out.$s" #!String
event_speaker_kids6: "Oh...$s#$b#That's kind of sad... but I guess I can understand your point.$s" #!String
event_speaker_yes: "Great!$h#$b#Let me just call the children over." #!String
event_speaker_no: "Really?... Uh... Well, alright. I guess I'll see you later then.%fork$s" #!String
event_mail1: "Thank you...$l#$b#I just wish George wasn't so upset... I was only trying to help.$s" #!String
event_mail2: "Oh... I guess you're right.$l#$b#I'm sorry, Mr. Mullner. It was rude, what I did.$s" #!String
event_mail3: "I see." #!String
event_old1: "I guess you're right... why stress out about something you can't change?$u" #!String

event_old2: "You're right, we shouldn't ignore the reality of aging.$u#$b#I guess the sooner we come to terms with our mortality, the more time we can spend really living in the here-and-now.$u" #!String
event_old3: "That's nice of you to say... I totally agree with you.#$b#We should treat our elders with the same respect we hope to receive ourselves some day." #!String
event_old4: "That's a horrible thing to say. Life is a precious thing to waste like that!$a" #!String
event_cook1: "You really mean it? Thank you! ... it's such a relief to hear that.$h#$b#I've been working so hard on this recipe, and I'm really proud of it." #!String
event_cook2: "Oh... Uh, sure.$s" #!String
event_cook3: "Oh...I'm sorry.$s" #!String
event_pool1: "That's right...$8" #!String
event_pool2: "Really? I thought you'd have noticed by now...$8" #!String
event_pool3: "No!$9" #!String
event_pool4: "...Oh, @. I thought you did, but I wasn't sure.$6#$b#...I'll always remember this night.$6^You look so beautiful tonight... I... *gasp*$6" #!String
event_pool5: "Y...You don't?$8#$b#...!!!%fork$10" #!String
event_family1: "Me too.$h" #!String
event_family2: "...sorry.$s" #!String
event_family3: "I see.$s" #!String
summer_Mon: "Hi... Um, nice weather, isn't it?" #!String
summer_Mon4: "$d cc#Thanks for fixing the community center back up. I guess you're kind of a town hero.|Hello, @. It's nice to see you're doing well." #!String

summer_Fri: "$d bus#I heard you were responsible for fixing the bus back up. Thank you.|My mother used to drive the bus to Calico Desert... but the bus stopped working a few years ago. Mayor says there's not enough money in the town coffers, or else he'd have it fixed.$u" #!String
summer_Sun: "So... do you like to decorate your farm house?#$e#It must be nice having your own place to decorate." #!String
summer_Sat: "Hello. Ummm...$u#$b#The mountains look nice today, don't they?$u" #!String
fall_Mon: "Hi... Um, are you doing okay?$u" #!String
fall_Mon4: "It's kind of embarrassing to be the only family in town who lives in a trailer.$u#$e#I wish I could live in a nice house, someday.$s" #!String
fall_Tue4: "Your farm looks really pretty right now.$h" #!String
fall_Thu6: "Mom doesn't take very good care of herself...$u#$e#I worry about her.$u" #!String
fall_Fri: "Fall is a sad time of year for me...$s" #!String

fall_Fri6: "When I was a little girl, my father abandoned us because he said he felt 'trapped'. We haven't seen him since.$s#$b#I'm sorry to make things uncomfortable for you... It's just that this time of year makes me think of it for some reason.$u#$e#Anyway... How's the farming life going?" #!String
fall_Sun10: "@! I was just thinking about the future...#$e#Where do you picture yourself in ten years?$l#$e#I have a few ideas for myself...$u" #!String
fall_Sat8: "Hi @.$h#$e#Your farmhouse must be pretty easy to clean, huh?" #!String
winter_Fri: "...yes?$u" #!String

winter_Fri2: "Are you friends with Linus? He lives in a tent up in the mountains.#$e#Everyone ignores him, the poor guy. He's actually really nice... Just a little odd.#$e#It must be so cold to live in a tent this time of year." #!String
winter_Tue4: "I'm looking forward to seeing what your farm looks like in the spring.#$e#It's going to be so fresh and beautiful.$h" #!String
winter_Tue: "I try to stay indoors as much as possible during the winter. I hate being cold." #!String

winter_Thu: "Oh... hi. You want to talk?$u#$e#If you find any interesting artifacts or minerals, Gunther will gladly display them in the museum.#$e#He told me he has special gifts for people who donate." #!String

winter_Mon: "On the 25th we'll be having the Feast of the Winter Star. It's one of my favorite events.#$e#It's supposed to be a time to show gratitude for all the good things in your life... but for most people it's just a time to relax and exchange gifts." #!String
